R

Reader<T> - Interface in fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.reader
A reader is an object that take a buffer (in write-mode) as input and process it to obtain an element of type T.

Current state of the reader.

RejectReader - Class in fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.reader
Reader used to ignore all bytes until the reading ofthe byte RejectReader.ERR_CODE followed by RejectReader.RECOVER_CODE.

reset() - Method in class fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.http.HTTPLineReader
Resets the reader to its initial state.
Note that the message will not be accessible with HTTPLineReader.get() until HTTPLineReader.process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
reset() - Method in class fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.http.HTTPReader
Resets the reader to its initial state.
Note that the packet will not be accessible with HTTPReader.get() until HTTPReader.process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
reset() - Method in class fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.packet.PacketReader
Resets the reader to its initial state.
Note that the packet will not be accessible with PacketReader.get() until PacketReader.process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
